summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is identified as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that belong to the BTEX group, which includes benzene, toluene, and xylenes. These compounds are categorized as organic chemicals due to their carbon-based structure and are commonly found in various industrial applications. The discussion highlights the environmental impact of these organic chemicals, particularly in relation to contamination in soil and groundwater from industrial activities and accidents.
